column13: APA adopts a three-line model for managing risks and establishing controls to promote the behaviours and decision-making to support effective risk management. This model of risk management is depicted below. Our employees are responsible for day-to-day risk management and decision-making within established guidelines. At the same time, APA's Executive Leadership Team, the Board's Risk Management Committee, and relevant business divisions provide ongoing oversight and review of significant risks with the assistance of internal and external experts.

- Accelerate: Environmental Management, including Heritage Management
- Maintain and Evolve: Safety, Health, and well-being, Inclusion and Diversity, People and Culture, and Governance and Risk Management

APAÃ¢ÂÂs remuneration objective is to reward executives at the median of observed total remuneration for selected comparable companies when performance is at target and up to the 75th percentile for above-target performance. APA has Fixed Pay, STI Plan, LTI Plan, etc.

Remuneration arrangements for Executive KMP are formalised in individual employment agreements. Termination arrangements, in addition to standard statutory entitlements, consisted of CEO/MD and GE Strategy & Commercial with each total fixed remuneration and notice period.

The Remuneration Report (the Report) for APA for FY23 has been prepared by Section 300A of the Corporations Act 2001. This Report includes the following KMP: Non-Executive Directors (NEDS), Former NEDS, Executive KMP, Former Executive KMP.

To continue to deliver the most positive impact for APA and the highest value for our stakeholders, we must regularly re-evaluate the sustainability issues that are most relevant to our business and stakeholders. It will enable us to assess the economic, social, environmental and cultural impacts of our activities and business relationships and refine our main focus areas and associated initiatives.

column13: In FY23 we prepared a revised Social Investment Framework and 2-year CSP Strategy which is scheduled for consultation in early Q1 FY24. This strategy seeks to elevate practices and drive consistency and awareness throughout the business.

column20: Local Landholders, Traditional Owners, New Infrastructure

column13: APA sees landholders as critical partners in our operations. With easements across many properties throughout the country, access to these properties is essential to maintaining and developing our infrastructure.
column14: In FY23, we made contact with 11,271 landholder contacts. Over the past few years, we have consistently achieved at least 80% of connections completed in all States. In most cases, we have achieved over 90%.
